Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About MS Reinsurance

MS Reinsurance is a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland with underwriting offices in Zurich, Bermuda, Miami, and New York. The Company underwrites non-life treaty reinsurance solutions on a worldwide basis through its three business units: Americas, International, and Specialty Lines. As part of the world-leading insurance group MS&AD, MS Reinsurance combines reliability and agility to make its clients’ businesses stronger. With a drive to move quickly and a commitment to long term partnership, MS Reinsurance supports its partners with the momentum and stability they can build on.




About the role

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst who will drive MS Reinsurance BI initiatives and play a pivotal role in execution of the data strategy. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for turning data into insight, helping to inform business decision-making by using a variety of tools and methodologies to analyse data and present findings.




Your responsibilities

Collect, analyse, and interpret raw data from various sources
Develop reports and dashboards to present actionable insights
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver solutions that meet these requirements
Ensure data accuracy and quality by implementing rigorous testing methods
Participate in the transformation of legacy systems, aiding in the evolution toward a data-centric business approach
Stay updated on technology trends and new Power BI trends
Develop, deploy, and maintain BI interfaces, including query tools, data visualization and interactive dashboards, and data modelling tools
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems and streamline data flow to enhance data collection procedures
Implement databases and systems to optimize the efficiency and quality of data analysis
Stay at the forefront of industry and technology trends to ensure effective data handling and presentation




Your profile

Power BI expert
3-7 years experience in the BI areas
Expert in Design thinking methodology
Good communication skills (English proficiency is a must)
Experienced to work in agile teams (Scrum / Kanban)
Logic-, Powe-App and Power Automate is a plus
Strong competency in Microsoft Azure, including Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Data Warehouse / Lakehouse, Power BI, Power Automate, Power App and Logic App, Data Quality and other Azure services
Expert with Power BI creating dynamic dashboards meaningful reports telling a data story by producing end products and good user experience
Deep understanding with data modelling, SQL, DAX, Python and other programming languages including data warehousing principals
Excellent analytics skills with the ability to collect, analyse, organize and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization







What we offer

We offer a modern workplace, an entrepreneurial culture with room for innovation and a hybrid work model. Collaboration, Empowerment and Responsibilities are key values we live on a day-to-day basis. You will be part of a hands-on culture where you really can make an impact. We place mutual trust at the forefront of our collaboration and path to growth.




Note that we will only consider applicants eligible to work in Switzerland.




In case of questions, please contact us via email: careers@msreinsurance.com




MS Reinsurance is the market-facing brand of the risk carrying legal entity MS Amlin AG, a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland and operating in Bermuda as MS Amlin AG, Bermuda Branch, in the United States through MS Amlin Reinsurance Managers, Inc, and in Labuan, Malaysia as MS Amlin AG, Labuan Branch.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ALTEN Group

Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defence & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.

ALTEN Switzerland

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland’s activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.

Main responsibilities

Design, implement, and maintain robust ETL pipelines using AWS services (Glue, Lambda, Step Functions) and Snowflake, focusing on transforming and loading data from various sources into fact and dimension tables.
Develop and optimize complex SQL queries for data transformation and analysis in both AWS Athena and Snowflake, with a strong emphasis on star and snowflake schema implementations.
Create and maintain data models, ensuring proper implementation of fact and dimension tables to support business intelligence and reporting needs.
Build and manage scalable data ingestion pipelines in AWS Data Lake, including setting up Lake Formation for cross-account data sharing.
Implement data quality checks and alert mechanisms based on defined business rules using AWS services and custom solutions.
Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like AWS CloudFormation or Terraform to provision and manage AWS resources.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, versioning, and deployment of data solutions.
Ensure data privacy, compliance, and security throughout the solution lifecycle, including proper configuration of AWS IAM and Lake Formation.
Monitor data pipelines and infrastructure using AWS CloudWatch and other relevant tools.

Main requirements

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technical field
5+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role
Strong knowledge of AWS services, particularly in the context of data processing (e.g. Lambda, Step Functions, S3, Athena, Glue, Lake Formation, CloudFormation)
You have advanced SQL skills, capable of writing complex queries for data transformation and analysis.
Proficiency in Python
Experience with mainstream data integration/ ETL platforms
Experience with CI/CD tools and general DevOps practices

What we offer you

At Alten, we offer you the security of a permanent contract while also giving you the liberty to work with multiple prestigious clients. With the luxury of having a wide range of offices around the world, we are in a unique position to provide you with the freedom to experience national and international business opportunities. Thus, we function in a highly innovative market, always being up to date with the latest technologies and making you a pioneer in your field.

Therefore, we offer our employees sought-after trainings and workshops ranging from hard to soft skills and providing you with certificates that will further increase your qualifications, enabling you to participate in ground-breaking projects.

Apply now and be a part of our amazing journey. We believe in growing together!

Show more

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technical field
  • 5+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role
  • Strong knowledge of AWS services, particularly in the context of data processing (e.g. Lambda, Step Functions, S3, Athena, Glue, Lake Formation, CloudFormation)
  • You have advanced SQL skills, capable of writing complex queries for data transformation and analysis.
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Experience with mainstream data integration/ ETL platforms
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and general DevOps practices

What we offer you

At Alten, we offer you the security of a permanent contract while also giving you the liberty to work with multiple prestigious clients. With the luxury of having a wide range of offices around the world, we are in a unique position to provide you with the freedom to experience national and international business opportunities. Thus, we function in a highly innovative market, always being up to date with the latest technologies and making you a pioneer in your field.

Therefore, we offer our employees sought-after trainings and workshops ranging from hard to soft skills and providing you with certificates that will further increase your qualifications, enabling you to participate in ground-breaking projects.

Apply now and be a part of our amazing journey. We believe in growing together!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Experis is a globally leading provider of personalized recruitment solutions and IT specialists.

For our client, we are looking for a committed and experienced Data Engineer (m/f/d) to strengthen the team in Zurich. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop innovative digital solutions that enhance the performance and sustainability of our client's operations.

Start: ASAP or by agreement

Contract type: Permanent position

Location: Zurich

Work model: Hybrid (Home office by agreement)

Workload: 80-100%

Responsibilities

Design and Development: You will design and develop customized digital platform components that optimize the operational processes of our clients.
Monitor Machine Fleets: Participate in our industry segment team to implement advanced tools and analytical models, mainly in the backend.
Promote Innovation: Contribute creative ideas and push the boundaries of our business.

Requirements:

Technical Excellence: Proven experience in building highly available, scalable, and cost-efficient software systems.
Programming Skills: Strong knowledge of Java or Python; experience with Scala and reactive programming is a plus.
Platform Expertise: At least 3 years of experience with microservices, distributed systems, messaging brokers, and event processing (Apache Spark, Flink, or Beam).
Cloud and Container Technologies: Solid understanding of cloud environments (ideally AWS) and containerized technologies like Kubernetes.
Database Knowledge: Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases.
Tech Enthusiast: Passion for new technologies, especially in the area of turbomachinery.
Agile Mindset: Experience in test-driven development environments and international collaboration.
Language Skills: Fluent in English; basic German skills for effective collaboration.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens, or current holders of a valid Swiss work permit.

Our client offers you the opportunity to work in an exciting and forward-looking environment, continuously developing your skills. If you feel addressed and meet the required qualifications, we look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Finance Process & Data Analyst
Description:
Be part of an exciting journey by supporting Richemont International SA (RISA) Finance, based in Fribourg, in our transformation into a more standardized, automated, and data-driven department.

As a member of the RISA Finance Digital Transformation team, you will act as an internal consultant to lead automation and process improvement initiatives across various teams within RISA Finance (Accounting, Financial Planning, Treasury, and ICS).

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

PROCESS


Gather, validate, and document business requirements
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation
Support business transition and drive change management (working closely with end users)
Manage projects according to set requirements, milestones and deadlines
Engage with key stakeholders (technical and non-technical) at every stage of an initiative
Deliver presentations and project walkthroughs to a wide-ranging audience composed of various levels of seniority in the organization


TOOLS


Identify most suitable technical solution for each use case
Implement and coordinate implementation of solutions using selected tools
Design to-be solutions, perform testing and coordinate go-live activities
Ensure proper documentation, maintenance, and continuous improvement of existing products (i.e., Chatbot, Power Automate flows, Power BI dashboards)


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Mandatory


You hold a university degree in business, finance, computer science or similar
You bring a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience in an international environment
You have experience with agile project management
You are hands on with low-code automation tools (i.e., Power Apps, UiPath, Celonis or similar)
You speak English and French fluently
You have a strategic mindset, capable of presenting findings and recommendations
You are a good team player
You are curious, open minded and like to independently search for an innovative solutions


Desirable


Experience in database management
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or any other programming language
Understanding of the basic financial concepts (i.e., Purchase to Pay)
Experience in using SAP (or any other ERP solution) or Anaplan
Experience in developing BI solutions (using Power BI, Tableau, Looker or similar)


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.


We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity
We care for the world we live in


Your Journey With Us

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will provide an answer promptly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will then be a face-to-face interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

Title: Data Analyst - Metals Sector
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.







Responsibilities

Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including.
Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager. Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.




Qualification

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, Materials Science and engineering or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field.
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills in Python.
Basic modeling skill.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.




The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.




Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Zürich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.




Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.




Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database—a comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.




Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date




Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
En tant que Analytics Specialist, tu es responsable du concept de mesure, de la spécification technique et de l'analyse des données de performance des sites web et des applications mobiles de Wingo, M-Budget et Coop Mobile. Tu implémentes et gères des solutions d'analyse pour collecter des données précises, faire des recommandations stratégiques et optimiser l'expérience utilisateur et les ventes en ligne.



Conception, spécification et gestion du concept de mesure pour les plateformes numériques
Mise en œuvre de technologies de collecte de données pour les analyses clés
Analyse des données pour identifier les possibilités d'amélioration et les stratégies de croissance
Collaboration avec les équipes de contenu et de développement pour mettre en œuvre des optimisations basées sur les données
Création de rapports de performance et mesure de l'efficacité des mesures



Votre profil



Maîtrise des outils d'analyse web (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Looker Studio, ContentSquare, etc.)
Expérience en intégration de solutions d'analytics
Connaissances de base en SEO et en optimisation des taux de conversion (CRO)
Expérience dans la gestion de projets numériques



Ce qui te distingue



Analytique, proactif-ve et orienté-e résultats
Excellente capacité à communiquer des insights complexes de manière claire
Compétences en outils modernes de la stack de données comme SQL ou Python
De langue maternelle française ou allemande avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais



Ce qui nous définit, c'est toi.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Profil du candidat


You are a young graduate and have demonstrated a first successful experience as a Data Engineer with a background in PySpark, AWS, DataOps, and/or DevOps.
You have strong programming skills in languages such as Python and SQL.
You have a previous experience with data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
You show a strong interest for the commodities trading or energy sectors.
You are an excellent problem-solver and you pay attention to detail.
You have strong communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment.



Activités

Are you a Data Engineer with a passion for innovation and problem-solving? We are looking for a talented individual with expertise in Databricks, AWS, DataOps and/or DevOps to join our team and help us harness the power of data.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement complex data solutions using Databricks and AWS.
Develop and maintain scalable and reliable data pipelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions.
Implement DataOps and DevOps best practices to improve the efficiency and quality of data delivery.
Monitor and optimize data systems to ensure optimal performance.



What We Offer:


A dynamic and challenging work environment with opportunities for growth and development.
A collaborative team that values innovation and creativity.
A commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.



If you are a Data Engineer looking for an exciting new challenge and the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, we would love to hear from you. Apply now and take the next step in your career with us!

Contexte et environnement

Role Overview: As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and maintaining our data infrastructure. You will work closely with our team to design, build, and optimize data pipelines, ensuring the highest quality of data availability and accuracy.

Title: Business- / Data Analyst 80 - 100 %
Description:
Luzern

unbefristet

Eine Laufbahn im Stabsbereich Innovation bei der Suva ist weit mehr als eine sichere Arbeitsstelle. Bei uns übernimmst du Verantwortung für digitale Lösungen im Schadenmanagement. Du treibst in einem cross-funktionalen Team die Digitalisierung für den Werkplatz Schweiz voran. Damit leistest du einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Sicherheit und Gesundheit der Schweiz bei Arbeit und Freizeit. Lass dich überraschen und entwickle dich mit uns.

Was du bewegst


Der Ideenmanagement-Prozess im Schadenmanagement wird von dir koordiniert und geleitet, inklusive des Reportings.
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für das Enterprise Risk Management im Stabsbereich Innovation.
Im Trendmanagement sowie bei der Optimierung und Anpassung von Prozessen bringst du dich aktiv ein.
Die Prozessabbildung im ARIS unterstützt du tatkräftig und beteiligst dich an der Prozessoptimierung.
Du führst Ad-hoc-Datenbankabfragen durch und analysierst Daten mittels Process Mining, wobei du die Verantwortung für diesen Bereich übernimmst.



 

Was wir erwarten


Du verfügst über einen Abschluss einer Fachhochschule, von Vorteil in Betriebswirtschaft oder Wirtschaftsinformatik oder über eine ähnliche Ausbildung.
Praktische Erfahrungen im Versicherungswesen, vorzugsweise im UVG, befähigen dich optimal für diese Funktion.
Interesse an Innovationsprozessen und der Datenanalyse ergänzen dein Profil und du überzeugst durch deine ausgeprägten Analyse- und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten.
Deine starke Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie dein ausgeprägtes Dienstleistungs- und Kundenbewusstsein zeichnen dich aus.
Einwandfreie Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Französischkenntnisse, runden dein Profil ab.



Was uns auszeichnet


Life-Balance ist uns wichtig. Deshalb bieten wir moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle und zentrumsnahe Standorte.
Wir leben Wertschätzung und ein unkompliziertes und kollegiales Miteinander.
Bei uns gibt es viele abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsinhalte mit hohem Gestaltungsspielraum.
Bei der Suva arbeiten macht und stiftet Sinn.



Wer sich auf dich freut

Nico Joller

Talent Acquisition Manager

041 419 5843
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (100% Remote - Switzerland)
Description:
About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code to construct data pipelines.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to understand and fulfill their data requirements.
Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of data pipelines.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems.
4+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Experience with machine learning algorithms and libraries.
Familiarity with data visualization tools.
Show more

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
  • Experience with machine learning algorithms and libraries.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant
Company: Berkeley Square - Talent Specialists in IT & Engineering
Description:
Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant

Location: Zurich/Remote




At Berkeley Square, we are dedicated to connecting top talent with leading organizations. As a recruitment agency, we specialize in identifying and placing exceptional candidates for a diverse range of roles.




About the Role: As a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will be instrumental in helping our client achieve their data-driven goals. You will collaborate closely with the client to understand their needs and deliver tailored BI solutions that drive strategic decision-making. This role requires a mix of technical expertise and business insight.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to gather and analyze business requirements.
Design and develop BI solutions, including reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Implement and configure BI tools and platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Develop and maintain ETL processes to integrate and transform data from various sources.
Perform data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support business objectives.
Provide recommendations and best practices for data management and BI strategies.
Train and support clients in the use of BI tools and solutions.
Monitor and optimize BI performance to ensure efficiency and reliability.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or QlikView.
Strong experience in SQL and data modeling.
Knowledge of ETL processes and data warehousing concepts.




Preferred Skills:

Experience with data science techniques and machine learning.
Familiarity with cloud-based BI platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).
Relevant certifications in BI tools or data analysis.
Fluent in German and English.




Pay range and compensation package: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for professional growth and development. A supportive and collaborative work environment. Remote work option. Access to the latest BI tools and technologies.




If you are a skilled Business Intelligence Consultant interested in working with a forward-thinking company, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Data and Compliance Analyst (Junior)
Description:
Data and Compliance Analyst vacancy for a globally operating Zurich based company in the Banking sector.

Your Tasks


Taking responsibility for regulatory reports in collaboration with the Compliance Analytics Team
Keeping the inventory of scripts and reports up to date
Extracting common elements as well as proposing standards
Updating the report documentation

2+ years of working experience as a Data or Business Analyst or in another relevant position
Familiarity with financial services with focus on non-financial risk like Compliance, Risk Management and Legal
Proficiency in database programming, for example with SQL
Knowhow in project management or business analysis
University degree in STEM fields, economics or banking and finance
Language skills: English – fluent in written and spoken



Your Soft Skills


Team player with excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
A high degree of self-organisation and time management



Location: Zürich, Switzerland

Work setting: Hybrid

Sector: Banking

Start: 10/2024

Duration: 03MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH 22101

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Business Insights and Analytics Intern
Description:
To support our team in Switzerland we are looking for a Business Insights and Analytics Intern.




Are you ready to make a meaningful impact on patients' lives while gaining invaluable experience in business analytics? Novocure is seeking a dynamic and analytical individual to join our team as a Business Insights and Analytics Intern. This part-time position (50-70% time commitment) reports to the Associate Director of Business Insights and Analytics and involves collaborating with our international team to support and optimize our business reporting processes.




Your responsibilities:

Develop, prepare, and optimize monthly business excellence reporting and associated analytics across international markets.
Work closely with the Senior Specialist and Associate Director to analyze and interpret data, providing actionable insights to country General Managers.
Ensure data accuracy and reliability through robust data validation processes.
Analyze internal datasets to identify trends, patterns, and business implications.
Develop new dashboards and alerts within our International Business Operations reporting framework.
Gather feedback from various business units to address evolving needs and translate them into actionable insights.




Your profile:

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Business, Data Analytics, a Scientific field, or a related discipline with a strong analytical component.
Previous experience in data analysis through internships, academic projects, or relevant work.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word); experience with Power BI, SQL, or other data analysis tools is desirable but not essential.
Commitment to accuracy in all outputs.
Interest in business strategy, healthcare, and the implications of analytics on business operations.
Ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely in English.
Collaborative mindset and willingness to work closely with the Business Analytics team and other stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines.




About us:

Novocure is a global publicly-traded commercial-stage oncology company developing a profoundly different cancer treatment therapy called tumor treating fields (TTFields) for patients with solid tumors. TTFields therapy is a non-invasive, novel, antimitotic treatment modality which utilizes proprietary technology attempting to slow or reverse tumor progression by inducing tumor cell death. Novocure's commercialized product, Optune, is approved for the treatment of adult patients with glioblastoma (GBM) in the USA, Europe and Israel. Novocure has ongoing or completed clinical trials and is further expanding its efforts into several other solid tumor indications - non-small cell lung cancer, pancreatic cancer and other types of solid cancers.




We are looking forward to receive your application through our ApplicantPortal. Please find more information about Novocure and our therapy on our website www.novocure.com or by consulting our patient testimonial videos.

Title: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Position: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?

Then, this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.

We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.

A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.

Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :


You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, …);
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth;
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions;
You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.


What we offer:


Responsibilities as of Day 1 – You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning
Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring– you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.


Job Qualifications

What we are looking for:

Masters Students with:


Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a “can-do” approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Data Analytics background a plus


Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:


Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)


WHO WE ARE:

P&G is one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash®, Gillette®, Pantene®, Oral-B®, Swiffer®, Head & Shoulders®, Braun®, Fairy®.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114493

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Engineer Intern (Python)
Description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 20 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda has offices in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Data Engineer Intern (Python) to be a part of our Inflation Trading Team, in 2025 for a 6-month internship in Zug, Switzerland. This is an exciting position offering opportunities to gain exposure to software development and portfolio management practices at a global hedge fund.

Position Responsibilities


Aid in the development of new lines of business solutions using Python, and SQL
Support senior investment staff by owning data extraction and ingestion from websites, transformation, tooling and automation
Provide support for in-house and 3rd party applications


Qualifications & Desired Skills


Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Quantitative Finance
Experience with the Python ecosystem of common libraries and working knowledge of at least one statically typed language
Good grasp of computer science fundamentals (e.g. data structures, algorithms, operating systems etc.)
Familiarity with object-oriented programming
Strong problem-solving skills and commitment to high standards for code
Interest or prior experience in the financial trading industry (particularly in fixed income) a plus
Ability to work effectively in a high-energy, time-sensitive team environment
Detail-oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills

Title: Master Data Intern
Description:
End of studies internship - January/February 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: 1752, Villars-sur-Glâne, Switzerland

Within Richemont Group, Cartier Processe Excellence Team is seeking a Master Data Intern for a 6-months mission.

Context

The purpose of this role is to guarantee the robustness of the article data processes for the distribution of our products, manage and implement new business & Compliance needs.

How will you make an impact?

You will be part of a highly established team, and you will contribute to the following missions:


Contribute to transversal projects with multiple stakeholders (Manufactures, Marketing, Richemont Compliance, Group Tech…)
Identify new business needs, propose, test and implement solutions.
Monitor the operational performance of the data management processes.
Standardize processes and develop news tools and dashboards


Your profile


You are in your last year master’s degree in Supply Chain Management from an Engineering or Business School
You have advanced skills in Excel and/or experience with PowerBi and/or SAP
You have a taste for innovation and IT tools
You are organized, autonomous and reliable
You have a very good command of French and English


How do we keep you smiling?

You will be a part of a dynamic and international work environment, where we always go the extra mile to uphold outstanding service for our clients.

Your journey with us

Your application will be carefully reviewed by the HR team. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LocationBinningen, Basel-Landschaft, SwitzerlandBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23614Published8 days ago

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with expertise in Veeva CRM and Power BI to join one of our clients in Biotech. This role is crucial in supporting commercial excellence through effective data integration, insightful visualizations, and upskilling internal teams on optimizing the use of Veeva CRM. You will collaborate closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to drive impactful business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Data Integration: Lead the integration of commercial and CRM data into Veeva CRM, ensuring accurate and seamless data flow.
Upskilling Teams: Provide informal training and support to internal teams on maximizing the use of Veeva CRM software.
Power BI Visualization: Analyze complex datasets and create meaningful visualizations using Power BI to aid decision-making for internal stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to support commercial excellence through data-driven insights.
Performance Reviews: Assist in preparing monthly performance reviews for different countries by extracting and analyzing CRM and sales data.



Required Skills And Experience


5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on Veeva CRM and Power BI.
Expertise in Veeva CRM, including experience with data integration and process optimization.
Proven ability to create insightful, actionable visualizations in Power BI.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across multiple departments (marketing, sales, IT, and executives).
Biotech, rare diseases, or product launch experience preferred.
Multilingual capabilities (German or French) are a plus but not required.
A go-getter attitude, with a passion for data and driving business results.



Position: Data Analyst

Contract: 12 months

Location: Switzerland (EU remote options)

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

If interested, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

If interested, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Title: Stagiaire Data Analyst
Description:
Afin de renforcer le département R&D de notre Manufacture, nous recrutons actuellement un :

Stagiaire Data Analyst (6 mois)

Votre Mission

Vous serez en charge d'élaborer un nouveau jeu de rapports d'analyse et d’indicateurs des données chronométrique des lignes d’assemblage mouvement, qui permettra de :


Faciliter la prise de décision pour le département production et qualité à court terme grâce à un monitoring régulier des taux d’échec, des encours de contrôle et des variationa de chronométrie journalière.
D’anticiper les tendances et faire apparaitre d’éventuelles dérives process à moyen/long terme.


COMMENT ALLEZ-VOUS FAIRE LA DIFFÉRENCE ?


Collaborer avec les équipes R&D, Production, Qualité et Excellence Opérationnel et technique pour recueillir et analyser les données relatives à la chronométrie mouvement, les taux de décottage.
Créer un jeu de rapports et des visualisations clairs et concis pour communiquer des données complexes aux parties prenantes des différents départements.
Travailler en partenariat avec d'autres Business Analysts issus d'autres départements pour uniformiser votre manière de travailler et assurer la pérennité de vos délivrables.


QUELLES SONT LES CLES DE VOTRE REUSSITE AU SEIN DE NOTRE MAISON ?


Diplôme en cours de master en ingénierie, en science des données ou dans un domaine connexe.
Expérience confirmée des outils et techniques d'analyse de données, tels que Power BI et Python.
La maitrise de SQL est un plus.
Forte compréhension des concepts d'analyse statistique.
Expert en Microsoft Office, en particulier Excel.
Français courant, anglais avancé.
Esprit curieux, analytique et synthétique.
Autonome, axé résultats, rigoureux, proactif et soif d’apprendre.


Show more

Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Die Hays Schweiz AG sucht aktuell im Kanton Aargau einen Data Warehouse Analyst (m/w) für unseren Kunden, einen Kernkraftwerk. Hier sind weitere Informationen zur Stelle:




Ihre zukünftige Aufgaben als Data Warehouse Analyst:




Zusammenführen von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen unterschiedlicher Formate aus unterschiedlichen Datenquellen
Aufbereiten zusammengeführter Daten für ihre Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
Erkennen von relevanten Mustern und Analysieren von Zusammenhängen in Daten
Erstellen von Reports zu Datenanalysen und Entwicklung von komplexen Algorithmen (z.B. Clustering, lineare Regression, neuronale Netze, Entscheidungsbäume) für das Ermitteln von Ursache-Wirkungs-Zusammenhängen sowie für das Erstellen von quantitativen Prognosemodellen
Integrieren automatisierter Datenanalysen in ICT-Prozesse und Beraten bei der Durchführung von Auswertungen sowie bei der Optimierung von Datenanalysen
Mitgestalten einer unternehmensweiten Datenarchitektur




Erforderliche Qualifikationen:




Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Bereich sowie berufliche Erfahrung
Kenntnisse über Datenbankmanagementsysteme und Data-Warehousing Konzepte sowie die Fähigkeit, Geschäftsanforderung in technische Spezifikationen zu übersetzen
Vertrautheit mit Tools zur Datenvisualisierung (z.B. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView), mit der Prinzipen der Datenmodellierung, Data Integration und Data Governance sowie Kenntnisse über bewährte Verfahren der Datenvisualisierung und des Berichtswesens
Vertrautheit mit Back-End Technologien (z.B Java, Python, C#, C++)
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Englischkenntnisse




Start: ab sofort nach Vereinbarung, Oktober gewünscht

Dauer: 24 Monaten mit Option auf Verlängerung (Übernahme jederzeit möglich)

Einsatzort: Kernkraftwerk Beznau, Kanton Aargau (2 Tage remote pro Woche nach der Einarbeitung)




Wenn Sie die Herausforderungen erfüllen und Interesse haben freue ich mich auf Ihre vollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen (CV + Zeugnisse + relevante Diplome und Zertifikate).




Samy

Show more

Title: Data Analyst & ProjektleiterIn, 80 – 100 %
Description:
Die Meier + Cie AG ist das führende Medienunternehmen der Region Schaffhausen. Jeden Tag informieren wir zuverlässig auf allen relevanten Kanälen über das Geschehen in und um Schaffhausen, in der Schweiz und der ganzen Welt. Zu unseren wichtigsten Medien gehören die «Schaffhauser Nachrichten» und die Digitalplattform shn.ch.




Per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung suchen wir eine Verstärkung für unser Team als




Data Analyst & ProjektleiterIn, 80 – 100 %




Dein Beitrag:

Du fühlst dich für die Digitalisierung unserer Produkte und Marken verantwortlich
Du koordinierst interne und externe Projekte im Bereich Inhaltsdistribution
Du analysierst Daten, bereitest sie auf und gibst entsprechende Handlungsempfehlungen
Du bist ein/e TeamplayerIn, der/die die Zusammenarbeit abteilungsübergreifend vorantreibt

 

Deine Fähigkeiten:

Du kennst dich mit Analyse- und Tag-Tools aus sowie mit Content Management Systemen, Social Media und SEO
Du hast Grundkenntnisse in HTML, CSS und JavaScript
Du bist gut organisiert, zielorientiert und weisst, wie man Projekte erfolgreich umsetzt
Du kennst die Grundlagen der Medienproduktion und weisst wie man Inhalte kanalgerecht distribuiert

 

Gründe, bei den «Schaffhauser Nachrichten» zu arbeiten:

Arbeitsplatz im Herzen der Altstadt
Unterstützung bei Weiterbildungen
Flache Hierarchien
Gute Sozialleistungen
Mitarbeiterevents
DU-Kultur




Fühlst Du dich von dieser spannenden Stelle angesprochen?

Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung per E-Mail:

«Schaffhauser Nachrichten»

Heidi Hess, Personalstelle,

heidi.hess@shn.ch




Bei Fragen rund um diese Stelle gibt Dir Philipp Honegger gerne Auskunft.

Telefon 052 633 35 55

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Metals Sector
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.







Responsibilities

Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including.
Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager. Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.




Qualification

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, Materials Science and engineering or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field.
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills in Python.
Basic modeling skill.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.




The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.




Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Zürich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.




Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.




Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database—a comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.




Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date




Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
En tant que Analytics Specialist, tu es responsable du concept de mesure, de la spécification technique et de l'analyse des données de performance des sites web et des applications mobiles de Wingo, M-Budget et Coop Mobile. Tu implémentes et gères des solutions d'analyse pour collecter des données précises, faire des recommandations stratégiques et optimiser l'expérience utilisateur et les ventes en ligne.



Conception, spécification et gestion du concept de mesure pour les plateformes numériques
Mise en œuvre de technologies de collecte de données pour les analyses clés
Analyse des données pour identifier les possibilités d'amélioration et les stratégies de croissance
Collaboration avec les équipes de contenu et de développement pour mettre en œuvre des optimisations basées sur les données
Création de rapports de performance et mesure de l'efficacité des mesures



Votre profil



Maîtrise des outils d'analyse web (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Looker Studio, ContentSquare, etc.)
Expérience en intégration de solutions d'analytics
Connaissances de base en SEO et en optimisation des taux de conversion (CRO)
Expérience dans la gestion de projets numériques



Ce qui te distingue



Analytique, proactif-ve et orienté-e résultats
Excellente capacité à communiquer des insights complexes de manière claire
Compétences en outils modernes de la stack de données comme SQL ou Python
De langue maternelle française ou allemande avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais



Ce qui nous définit, c'est toi.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Profil du candidat


You are a young graduate and have demonstrated a first successful experience as a Data Engineer with a background in PySpark, AWS, DataOps, and/or DevOps.
You have strong programming skills in languages such as Python and SQL.
You have a previous experience with data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
You show a strong interest for the commodities trading or energy sectors.
You are an excellent problem-solver and you pay attention to detail.
You have strong communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment.



Activités

Are you a Data Engineer with a passion for innovation and problem-solving? We are looking for a talented individual with expertise in Databricks, AWS, DataOps and/or DevOps to join our team and help us harness the power of data.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement complex data solutions using Databricks and AWS.
Develop and maintain scalable and reliable data pipelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions.
Implement DataOps and DevOps best practices to improve the efficiency and quality of data delivery.
Monitor and optimize data systems to ensure optimal performance.



What We Offer:


A dynamic and challenging work environment with opportunities for growth and development.
A collaborative team that values innovation and creativity.
A commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.



If you are a Data Engineer looking for an exciting new challenge and the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, we would love to hear from you. Apply now and take the next step in your career with us!

Contexte et environnement

Role Overview: As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and maintaining our data infrastructure. You will work closely with our team to design, build, and optimize data pipelines, ensuring the highest quality of data availability and accuracy.

Title: Exciting Part-Time Opportunity for Data Science Students! (40-80%)
Description:
MDPI Introduction

A pioneer in scholarly open-access publishing, MDPI has been supporting academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms and across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open-access journals, supported by over 35,500 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

Team Introduction / Position

To strengthen our AI team and the Technology Innovation department, we are looking for a working student in Data Science. This is a part-time position based in our city center office in Basel, Switzerland.

As a Data Science Student, you will be responsible for assisting with the development, experimentation, and creation of machine learning, statistical, and advanced mathematical algorithms for various applications, focusing on NLP, Graph Machine Learning, or LLM models. You will also support the analytics team by analyzing data and developing business dashboards for management.

Tasks & Responsibilities

Support the AI team in developing applications in the areas of NLP, LLM, and Graph Machine Learning.
Develop, optimize, and evaluate new machine learning and statistical models.
Explore new approaches and algorithms to solve specific business problems.
Research and compare prototype solutions.

Requirements

Currently enrolled as a BSc or MSc student in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics.
Theoretical and technical knowledge of machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
Proficiency in Python, including statistical and machine learning libraries (knowledge of other programming languages, such as R, is a plus).
Ability to create dashboards using Streamlit or Shiny is a plus.
Experience with deep learning development frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow) is beneficial.
Experience in applying and implementing NLP and/or Graph Machine Learning is advantageous.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate, document, share, and present ideas and results to both technical and non-technical audiences (fluency in English is required).
A creative team player with a results-oriented mindset.
Strong analytical thinking skills.

If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving your complete application. Please submit your cover letter and CV. We are excited about the possibility of welcoming you to our Basel office.

Initiatives
At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:
https://www.mdpi.com/
https://sciprofiles.com/
https://sciforum.net/
https://www.scilit.net/
https://www.preprints.org/
https://encyclopedia.pub/

Show more

If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving your complete application. Please submit your cover letter and CV. We are excited about the possibility of welcoming you to our Basel office.

Initiatives
At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:
https://www.mdpi.com/
https://sciprofiles.com/
https://sciforum.net/
https://www.scilit.net/
https://www.preprints.org/
https://encyclopedia.pub/

Title: Python Engineer – Data (Quant Finance)
Description:
Job Title: Python Engineer – Data (Quant Finance)




Location: Zurich (Switzerland)




Overview:




One of Europe’s leading trading firms is looking to hire a strong Python Engineer with a Data Engineering/Data Science background to join a fast-growing Zurich office. The firm in question takes a scientific approach to the markets, placing a large emphasis on research and technology.




In this role, you will have the chance to brush shoulders with some of the best minds from both inside and outside of finance, with your work having a direct impact on trading. As a result of this impact, you will be compensated in line with leading firms in the quant finance space.




What you’ll be doing:




You’ll be working closely alongside trading desks to understand their data needs and create datasets accordingly.
You will leverage internal tools to assist trading desks in their use of data for building trading systems.
You will manage data-sourcing initiatives across the full data lifecycle.




About you:




You are an expert Python programmer – C/C++ is a nice-to-have.
3+ years of experience working as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist or Data Analyst.
Knowledge of market data ecosystems, and an interest in financial markets, programming and data analysis.
You’ll have a post-graduate degree in Computing, Data Science or another relevant STEM subject.
You will be a strong communicator, able to work across multiple trading desks at a fast pace.
Previous finance experience




If you are a data-focused Python Engineer based in Switzerland and interested in having a direct impact at one of Europe’s leading trading firms, please apply.

Show more

Title: Business- / Data Analyst 80 - 100 %
Description:
Luzern

unbefristet

Eine Laufbahn im Stabsbereich Innovation bei der Suva ist weit mehr als eine sichere Arbeitsstelle. Bei uns übernimmst du Verantwortung für digitale Lösungen im Schadenmanagement. Du treibst in einem cross-funktionalen Team die Digitalisierung für den Werkplatz Schweiz voran. Damit leistest du einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Sicherheit und Gesundheit der Schweiz bei Arbeit und Freizeit. Lass dich überraschen und entwickle dich mit uns.

Was du bewegst


Der Ideenmanagement-Prozess im Schadenmanagement wird von dir koordiniert und geleitet, inklusive des Reportings.
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für das Enterprise Risk Management im Stabsbereich Innovation.
Im Trendmanagement sowie bei der Optimierung und Anpassung von Prozessen bringst du dich aktiv ein.
Die Prozessabbildung im ARIS unterstützt du tatkräftig und beteiligst dich an der Prozessoptimierung.
Du führst Ad-hoc-Datenbankabfragen durch und analysierst Daten mittels Process Mining, wobei du die Verantwortung für diesen Bereich übernimmst.



 

Was wir erwarten


Du verfügst über einen Abschluss einer Fachhochschule, von Vorteil in Betriebswirtschaft oder Wirtschaftsinformatik oder über eine ähnliche Ausbildung.
Praktische Erfahrungen im Versicherungswesen, vorzugsweise im UVG, befähigen dich optimal für diese Funktion.
Interesse an Innovationsprozessen und der Datenanalyse ergänzen dein Profil und du überzeugst durch deine ausgeprägten Analyse- und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten.
Deine starke Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie dein ausgeprägtes Dienstleistungs- und Kundenbewusstsein zeichnen dich aus.
Einwandfreie Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Französischkenntnisse, runden dein Profil ab.



Was uns auszeichnet


Life-Balance ist uns wichtig. Deshalb bieten wir moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle und zentrumsnahe Standorte.
Wir leben Wertschätzung und ein unkompliziertes und kollegiales Miteinander.
Bei uns gibt es viele abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsinhalte mit hohem Gestaltungsspielraum.
Bei der Suva arbeiten macht und stiftet Sinn.



Wer sich auf dich freut

Nico Joller

Talent Acquisition Manager

041 419 5843
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (100% Remote - Switzerland)
Description:
About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code to construct data pipelines.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to understand and fulfill their data requirements.
Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of data pipelines.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems.
4+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Experience with machine learning algorithms and libraries.
Familiarity with data visualization tools.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant
Company: Berkeley Square - Talent Specialists in IT & Engineering
Description:
Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant

Location: Zurich/Remote




At Berkeley Square, we are dedicated to connecting top talent with leading organizations. As a recruitment agency, we specialize in identifying and placing exceptional candidates for a diverse range of roles.




About the Role: As a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will be instrumental in helping our client achieve their data-driven goals. You will collaborate closely with the client to understand their needs and deliver tailored BI solutions that drive strategic decision-making. This role requires a mix of technical expertise and business insight.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to gather and analyze business requirements.
Design and develop BI solutions, including reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Implement and configure BI tools and platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Develop and maintain ETL processes to integrate and transform data from various sources.
Perform data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support business objectives.
Provide recommendations and best practices for data management and BI strategies.
Train and support clients in the use of BI tools and solutions.
Monitor and optimize BI performance to ensure efficiency and reliability.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or QlikView.
Strong experience in SQL and data modeling.
Knowledge of ETL processes and data warehousing concepts.




Preferred Skills:

Experience with data science techniques and machine learning.
Familiarity with cloud-based BI platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).
Relevant certifications in BI tools or data analysis.
Fluent in German and English.




Pay range and compensation package: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for professional growth and development. A supportive and collaborative work environment. Remote work option. Access to the latest BI tools and technologies.




If you are a skilled Business Intelligence Consultant interested in working with a forward-thinking company, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German
You must be living in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community




TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com







If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam63@telusinternational.ai

Title: ☑️👩🏽⚕️Pessoa Analista de Business Intelligence (BI) JR São Paulo - SP Efetivo
Description:
Descrição da vaga

A InterPlayers é o HUB de Negócios da Saúde e Bem-estar que promove ampla integração com todos os componentes do segmento farmacêutico e hospitalar, com destacada participação no mercado, integrando farmácias, clínicas, hospitais, distribuidores e indústrias em todo território nacional.

Aqui na IP, aprendemos sempre, e nos tornamos cada vez melhores em um ambiente de trabalho saudável, colaborativo e dinâmico!

São muito bem-vindas candidaturas de pessoas negras/pretas, mulheres, indígenas, LGBTQIA+, ou outros grupos menorizados.

Inscreva-se e conheça mais sobre nosso time 💙

Responsabilidades e atribuições

O objetivo do cargo de Business Intelligence (BI) é coletar, organizar e analisar dados para ajudar na tomada de decisões estratégicas da área de serviços ao paciente. Isso inclui criar relatórios, dashboards e análises básicas, além de fornecer suporte aos usuários das ferramentas de BI, quando aplicável.

As Principais Atribuições De Um Analista De Business Intelligence (BI) Geralmente Incluem Várias Responsabilidades e Tarefas Dentro Da Área De BI, Sendo


Coletar dados de diferentes fontes da empresa, como bancos de dados, planilhas, sistemas de CRM, etc., e integrá-los em um único ambiente de BI, ou consolidação de relatório.
Analisar dados para identificar tendências, padrões e insights que possam ajudar na tomada de decisão estratégica.
Desenvolver relatórios e dashboards interativos utilizando ferramentas de BI (como Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc.) para fornecer informações visuais e acionáveis para os usuários finais, ou outras ferramentas disponíveis para melhor compreensão dos dados solicitados.
Auxiliar na manutenção e otimização de bancos de dados utilizados para armazenamento de dados de BI, garantindo que os dados sejam precisos, acessíveis e estejam bem-organizados.
Prestar suporte técnico e treinamento básico aos usuários finais para ajudá-los a utilizar os relatórios e dashboards de forma eficaz.
Documentar processos, metodologias e modelos de dados para garantir a consistência e a replicabilidade das análises realizadas.
Apoiar o time de gestão e liderança na análise de dados, desenvolvimento e entender os requisitos que atendam às necessidades dos programas.
Manter-se atualizado com as novas tendências e tecnologias em BI e análise de dados para melhorar constantemente suas habilidades e conhecimentos.


Requisitos e qualificações

Ensino superior completo ou cursando em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia da Computação, Sistemas de Informação, Matemática, Estatística, Administração de Empresas ou áreas relacionadas a área da saúde.

Desejável

Excel intermediário a avançado;

Capacidade de realizar análises estatísticas e exploratórias de dados para identificar padrões e insights.

Conhecimento e experiência prévia em empresas do segmento da saúde

Informações adicionais


Modalidade de trabalho: das 08:30 as 18:30 horas segunda a sexta, presencial, no momento estamos híbrido podendo a qualquer momento voltar para presencial.


Benefícios


💳 Cartão Swile, R$ 36,00 dia com mais liberdade para usar seus benefícios (Refeição/Alimentação);
🏥 Assistência Médica + Telemedicina da Conecta Médicos;
🦷Assistência Odontológica;
🚝 Vale Transporte;
🫀Seguro de Vida;
💆+Telemedicina;
🤱🏻Auxílio Creche;
🐶😺🐾 PetLove - benefício exclusivo que oferece suporte para o cuidado e bem-estar do seu amigo de 4 patas, incluindo desconto em produtos e serviços veterinários;
🏋🏿‍♀️Gympass/TotalPass;
💆🏽 Dia de recarregar (Day off aniversário);
💸PPR (Programa de Participação nos Resultados);
💊Healthy (Programa de Benefício em Medicamentos) - que visa cuidar da saúde e proporcionar acesso a medicamentos com preços reduzidos;
📚 Aqui também estimulamos o aprendizado constante - parceria com instituições de ensino e escolas de idiomas;
🚀 Muitas possibilidades de crescimento - temos muito a crescer e esperamos fortemente que você nos ajude com isso!


Se interessou? #VemSerIPLover 🥰

Etapas do processo


Etapa 1: Cadastro1Cadastro
Etapa 2: Triagem2Triagem
Etapa 3: Entrevista com RH.3Entrevista com RH.
Etapa 4: Entrevista com Gestor 2° etapa!4Entrevista com Gestor 2° etapa!
Etapa 5: teste5teste
Etapa 6: carta oferta6carta oferta
Etapa 7: Contratação7Contratação


Venha Descobrir Mais Sobre a InterPlayers

Transformamos o cenário de saúde e bem-estar com soluções integradas. Aqui, dedicamos nossos esforços a aprimorar as operações em toda a indústria, conectando profissionais de saúde, distribuidores, hospitais, clínicas e pontos de venda para gerar valor em cada etapa do ciclo de negócios.

Nossa missão é clara: integrar a cadeia de valor na área de saúde e bem-estar.

Nosso propósito é tornar o acesso à saúde e bem-estar ainda melhor, promovendo uma mudança positiva.

Guiados por valores baseados em atitudes, através da integridade, transparência e honestidade, inovamos por meio da tecnologia, processos e, acima de tudo, pelas pessoas. Comprometemo-nos com resultados significativos e a satisfação de clientes, acionistas, parceiros e colaboradores.

#VemPraIP e descubra um lugar onde seu potencial é cultivado, suas ideias são valorizadas, e cada membro contribui para construir algo verdadeiramente especial.💙
Show more
